title: [K-12] Short-term Intensive Teacher Professional Development Course Using Online Communities of Practice (OCoP)

context.prior_knowledge: Experience with Basic Online Learning Tools and Practical Social Studies Education
context.additional_context: Emphasizes OCoP (Online Communities of Practice) operational competencies enabling asynchronous collaboration in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments.

learning_goals: Explain the core principles of OCoP (shared repertoire, interaction, joint learning) and apply them to social studies classes
Describe the OCoP-based lesson design process in three or more stages based on the TPACK framework
Utilize mobile-only OCoP platforms (e.g., Naver Band, KakaoTalk Open Chat) to establish a community of practice and plan three or more interaction activities

resources: OCoP (Online Communities of Practice) Case Study Compilation (PDF)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
